notes.en:
This word is used when referring to disruptors ({nISwI':n}), and is distinct from {baH:v}. The object of this verb is the {tIH:n:1} "energy beam" which is fired, for example, {nISwI' tIH bach}. In practice, the word {tIH:n:1,nolink} is commonly dropped, and one simply says {nISwI' bach} instead.[2]

The suffix {-Daq:n} marks the target.

bach:v.hidden_notes: {baH:v:nolink} is pronounced like the name of the Terran composer "Bach" by speakers of American English.

notes.en: See {KGT p.145:src} for an explanation of this verb.
notes.de: Siehe {KGT p.145:src} für Details zu diesem Verb.

bachHa':v.hidden_notes: This is the first word in the Klingon-English side of the dictionary portion of {KGT:src}, where it is incorrectly listed as a noun as a joke.

notes.en: This slang term is used for figuring out how to decrypt previously encrypted data (and successfully doing so), without knowing how to do so ahead of time. That is, it refers to unauthorized decryption.[1]
notes.de: Dieser umgangssprachliche Begriff wird verwendet, um verschlüsselte Daten erfolgreich zu entschlüsseln, ohne verher jedoch den Code zu kennen. Es ist also ein unerlaubtes Knacken einer Verschlüsselung.[1]
notes.ru: Данное сленговое выражение использовано для понимания как декодировать зашифрованные данные(и успешно это сделать), без понимания того, как это сделать досрочно.[1]

examples.en: {baHwI', DoS yIbuS. QuQ neH.:sen}

definition.de: Schütze, konzentriere dich auf das Ziel! Nur ausschalten.

definition.sv: tjäna, göra sig förtjänt av, arbeta för (aktivt)

baj:v.hidden_notes: A "badge" is something that has to be earned.

definition.en: face, have the prospect of having to deal with
definition.de: gegenüber stehen, von etwas bedroht werden
definition.ru: Наталкиваться, иметь перспективу имения дела с

bam:v.hidden_notes: The prefix in the example sentence is incorrect, as it should be {bo-:v:pref}. Possibly it was mixed up with {lI-:v:pref}, which forced {lIb:v} to be created.

examples.en: ▶ {Qob lIb bam SoH chuDlI' je.@@Qob:n, lIb:v, bam:v, SoH:n, chuD:n, -lI':n, je:conj} "You and your people are in danger."

notes.en: This is what Klingons would call the Terran fruit.

definition.sv: älskad, någon som är älskad, älskade

examples.en: ▶ {reH bang larghlu'.:sen}

notes.en: These are usually specific to a couple, and almost never uttered unless the couple is alone. A pet name is formed by adding the suffix {-oy:n:suff} to a noun.[1, p.199]
This word is used to signal surrender in a duel.
notes.ru: Это слово используется, чтобы подать сигнал о сдаче в поединке.

definition.en: toss bat'leth from one hand to the other
definition.de: das Bat'leth von einer Hand in die andere werfen
definition.sv: kasta en bat'leth från den ena handen till den andra
definition.ru: Перекидывать батлет из одной руки в другую

definition.en: be fresh, be just picked (fruit, vegetable)
definition.sv: vara färsk, vara nyplockad (om frukt, grönsak)
definition.ru: быть свежим, быть только что собранным (фрукт, овощ)

notes.en: This is not preferred to {DeH:v:is}.

notes.ru: Данное ругательство не имеет прямого перевода.

notes.en: She is the actress who plays {lurSa':n:name}.
notes.ru: Актриса, которая играет {lurSa':n:name}.

notes.en: The father of T'vis. See {tI'vIS:n}.
This is a Klingon game or contest which is similar to arm wrestling.
notes.ru: Это клингонская игра или состязание, очень похожее на армрестлинг.

definition.en: honor (general, philosophical concept, associated with integrity)
definition.de: Ehre (allgemeine, philosophische Bedeutung, mit Integrität assoziiert)
definition.ru: Честь (общее понятие, философское понятие, ассоциированное с целостностью)

notes.en: This word refers to a grander, more general, philosophical concept, in comparison to {quv:n}.[2]
notes.ru: Это слово относится к важному, более общему, философскому понятию, в сравнении с {quv:n}.[2]

definition.sv: ärofullt, med ära, med heder, hedervärt

definition.en: You will be remembered with honor.
definition.de: Man wird sich ehrenhaft an dich erinnern.
Halte dich ehrenvoll an die Sitten.

definition.en: An honorable death requires no vengeance.
definition.de: Ein ehrenvoller Tod erfordert keine Rache.

en: An honourable death requires no vengeance.

batlh potlh law' yIn potlh puS.:sen.entry_name: batlh potlh law' yIn potlh puS.

definition.en: Honor is more important than life.
definition.de: Die Ehre ist wichtiger als das Leben.

en: Honour is more important than life.

definition.en: A Klingon does not postpone a matter of honor.

en: A Klingon does not postpone a matter of honour.

definition.en: Defend the Klingon race with honor.
definition.de: Verteidige die klingonische Rasse mit Ehre.

batlh tlhIngan Segh yIHub.:sen.hidden_notes: This line was cut from {Star Trek V:src}.

examples.en:
▶ {batlhHa' vanglu'taHvIS quv chavbe'lu'.:sen}
▶ {Qu' buSHa'chugh SuvwI', batlhHa' vangchugh, qoj matlhHa'chugh, pagh ghaH SuvwI''e'.:sen}

definition.en: One does not achieve honor while acting dishonorably.
definition.de: Niemand erreicht Ehre durch unehrenhaftes Verhalten.
definition.ru: Одиночка не достигнет чести, пока действует бесчестно.

en: One does not achieve honour while acting dishonourably.

definition.sv: röra sig i en omloppsbana kring, kretsa kring

notes.en: The object is the thing being orbited. {-Daq:n:suff} is unnecessary.[2]

definition.en: be comfortable, be feeling prepared, be confident
definition.ru: быть удобным, чуствовать себя готовым, быть уверенным в себе

notes.en: This might be used to describe feeling prepared for an upcoming journey or battle.
notes.de: Dies könnte man benutzen um zu beschreiben, dass man sicher für einen Kampf oder eine Reise vorbereitet fühlt.
notes.ru: Это может быть использовано, чтобы описать ощущение подготовленности к грядущему путеществию или битве.

definition.en: be uncomfortable, be worried, be hesitant
definition.ru: Быть неудобным, быть тревожным, быть озабоченным, быть неуверенным

notes.en: This might be used to describe feeling unprepared for an upcoming journey or battle.
notes.de: Dies könnte man benutzen um zu beschreiben, dass man nicht sicher für einen Kampf oder eine Reise unvorbereitet fühlt.
notes.ru: Это может быть использовано, чтобы описать ощущение неподготовленности к грядущему путешествию или битве.

ba'Suq:n.hidden_notes: "Bazooka" is a brand of bubble gum. {ba'Suq'a' jo':sen@@ba'Suq:n, -'a':n, jo':v} means "he blows a great bubble".

notes.en: The {yor:n} of a {qach:n}, and the top face of a {pa' beb:n}.

beb:n.hidden_notes: "Babe Ruth" was an American baseball player.

notes.en: This refers to a person who lays out the shingles, planks, etc., when constructing a roof.
notes.ru: Это относится к человеку, который укладывает кровельные дранки,доски и т.д., когда сооружает крышу.

bech:v.hidden_notes: Possibly from the expression "bitch and moan".

notes.en: Two common kinds of {beH:n} are {nISwI' beH:n} and {pu'beH:n}.

definition.sv: vaka över, hålla ett öga på, titta på

examples.en: ▶ {bISutlhnISchugh jaghlI' mInDu' tIbej.:sen}

definition.en: be sure, be definite, be positive, be certain
definition.ru: быть уверенным, быть точным, быть достоверным, быть надежным

examples.en: ▶ {chobelHa'moH, DI'qar. SajlIj 'oHbe' quvwIj'e'.:sen:nolink} "You disappoint me, D'Kar. My honor is not your play-thing."[1]
examples.ru: ▶ {chobelHa'moH, DI'qar. SajlIj 'oHbe' quvwIj'e'.:sen:nolink} "Ты разочаровал меня, Д'Кар. Моя честь не твоя игрушка."[1]

notes.en:
In Klingon, instead of saying "I am X years old", one's age is expressed by saying "I was born X years ago."[2]

To say "when I was X years old", the construction is, for example, {qaStaHvIS DISwIj javDIch...:sen@@qaS:v, -taH:v, -vIS:v, DIS:n:2, -wIj:n, jav:n:1, -DIch:n} "When I was six years old...".[4]
notes.ru:
В клингонском языке, вместо того, чтобы говорить "Мне X лет",чей-то возраст выражается в произношении "Я был рожден X лет назад."[2]

Чтобы сказать "Когда мне было X лет", можно, например использовать следующую конструкцию, {qaStaHvIS DISwIj javDIch...:sen@@qaS:v, -taH:v, -vIS:v, DIS:n:2, -wIj:n, jav:n:1, -DIch:n} "Когда мне было шесть лет...".[4]

examples.en:
▶ {loSmaH ben jIboghpu'.:sen@@loS:n:1, maH:n:2, ben:n:1, jI-:v, bogh:v, -pu':v} "I am 40 years old."[2]
▶ {cha'vatlh ben HIq:n} "two century old ale"[3]
▶ {wa'maH ben loDnI'wI':n@@wa':n, maH:n:2, ben:n:2, loDnI':n, -wI':n} "My 10-year old brother"[4]
examples.ru:
▶ {loSmaH ben jIboghpu'.:sen@@loS:n:1, maH:n:2, ben:n:1, jI-:v, bogh:v, -pu':v} "Мне 40 лет."[2]
▶ {cha'vatlh ben HIq:n} "двухсотлетний эль"[3]
▶ {wa'maH ben loDnI'wI':n@@wa':n, maH:n:2, ben:n:2, loDnI':n, -wI':n} "Мой десятилетний брат"[4]

notes.en: A rank given to enlisted personnel in the Defense Force ({Hubbeq:n}).

beq:n.hidden_notes: A crewman is at "beck" and call.

definition.en: type of mineral, bekpuj (orange in color)
definition.sv: en slags mineral, bekpuj (starkt orange till färgen)

notes.en: This word may contain the element {puj:n:2,hyp} also found in {cha'puj:n}.
notes.ru: Это слово может содержать элемент {puj:n:2,hyp} также найденный в {cha'puj:n}.

examples.en: {puH beQ:n}

beQmoH:v.hidden_notes: This word does not appear in canon. This entry is here for ease of reference only.

definition.sv: vara irritabel, vara lättretlig, vara retlig

bergh:v.hidden_notes: This is defined in {TKD:src} only as "be irritable", but {berghmoH:v} "irritate" from {KGT:src} suggests that {bergh:v:nolink} can mean "be irritated".

definition.en: end (of an opera, play, story, speech)
definition.sv: avslutning, slut (på sång, pjäs, historia, etc.)
definition.ru: Конец, окончание( оперы, игры, истории, речи)

notes.en: This refers to the final section of a performance (last aria in an opera, last speech in a play, last sentence or so in a story or speech, etc.). For a song (and only for a song), the final portion is called its {'o'megh:n}.
notes.ru: Это относится к финальной секции представления(последняя ария в опере, последняя речь в игре, последнее предложение в речи истории и т.д).

bertlham:n.hidden_notes: This is a reference to Bertram from Shakespeare's "All's Well That Ends Well".

notes.en: This refers to a state of matter.
notes.ru: Это относится к состоянию материи.

betgham:n.hidden_notes: Bette Graham was the inventor of liquid paper (correction fluid).

notes.en:
The elements of the name of this weapon are archaic, but it means "sword of honor". In modern Klingon, of course, "sword of honor" would be {batlh 'etlh:n:nolink}. See {paq'batlh:n}.

In Klingon legend, the original Sword of Honor was forged by {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} from a lock of his hair dipped into the {qul ngeng:n} of the volcano {QIStaq:n}. The weapon is shaped like a {maS'e' loQ So'be'bogh QIb:n}.[5]

The {betleH:n:nolink} is also called the {betleH quv:n:nolink}, to differentiate it from the similar sounding {meqleH:n}.
notes.ru:
Элементы названия этого оружия архаичны, но они означают "меч чести". [In modern Klingon, of course,] "меч чести" будет {batlh 'etlh:n:nolink}. Смотрите также {paq'batlh:n}.

В Клингонской легенде, оригинальный меч чести выл выкован {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} из локона его волос, погруженный в {qul ngeng:n} вулкана {QIStaq:n}. Оружие имеет форму подобно {maS'e' loQ So'be'bogh QIb:n}.[5]

{betleH:n:nolink} также зовётся {betleH quv:n:nolink}, чтобы отличать его от похожего звучания {meqleH:n}.

betleH:n.hidden_notes: This word is misspelled {batleH:n:hyp,nolink} on {SkyBox 8:src}.[3] A message on the {s.k:src} newsgroup gives a bit of history behind the various spellings used in English for this word.[4]

examples.en:
▶ {qaStaHvIS wa'maH puq poHmey, wo'rIv betleH ghaj qorDu'Daj. nuja' tlhIngan wIch ja'wI'pu' yIntaHvIS qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay' batlh 'etlhvam chenmoHlu'pu'.:sen:nolink}
  "Worf's bat'telh has been in his family for ten generations. According to Klingon legend, this sword of honor descends from the time of Kahless the Unforgettable."[3]
examples.ru:
▶ {qaStaHvIS wa'maH puq poHmey, wo'rIv betleH ghaj qorDu'Daj. nuja' tlhIngan wIch ja'wI'pu' yIntaHvIS qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay' batlh 'etlhvam chenmoHlu'pu'.:sen:nolink}
  "Батлет Ворфа находился в его семье вот уже десять поколений. Согласно клингонской легенде, этот меч чести нисходит ко временам Кейлеса Незабываемого".[3]

bey:n.hidden_notes: "Bay" is an English word with the same meaning.

notes.en: This expression is known only through the sentence, from {SkyBox 31:src}, {beyHom bey bey'a' jachtaH latlh tlhInganpu'.:sen:nolink} "[Other Klingons] roar in a great crescendo."[1] Its exact grammar is unclear.

This is the way the name of B'Elanna Torres is pronounced, which isn't pronounced in a very Klingon way. The Klingon version of a name transcribed as "B'Elanna" would be {be'elanna:n:name,nolink} or {be'ela'na:n:name,nolink} or {bI'Ila'na:n:name,nolink} or something like that.
This word refers to a financial establishment.

beylI':n.hidden_notes: This is a reference to the Bailey Bros. Building & Loan Association, from the movie "It's a Wonderful Life".

notes.en: Known types of {bey':n:nolink} include the {betleH bey':n}, the {quv bey':n}, and the {nuH bey':n}.
notes.ru: Известные типы {bey':n:nolink} включают {betleH bey':n}, {quv bey':n}, и {nuH bey':n}.

notes.en: Sister of Lursa and Duras. She is portrayed by the actress {ghuwI'nItlh wa'lIS:n:name}.
notes.ru: Сестра Лурсы и Дюраса. Она сыграна актрисой {ghuwI'nItlh wa'lIS:n:name}.

examples.en:
▶ {DuraS tuq tlhIngan yejquv patlh luDub 'e' reH lunIDtaH DuraS be'nI'pu' lurSa' be'etor je. ngoQvam luchavmeH ghawran maghpu' be'nI'pu'. woQ luSuqmeH jIjpu' chaH romuluSngan'e' je.:sen:nolink}
  "The sisters of the House of Duras, Lursa and B'Etor, are constantly seeking a higher standing for the House of Duras within the Klingon High Council. To this end, the sisters have acted against Gowron, going as far as to work with Romulan factions in order to gain power."[2]
examples.ru:
▶ {DuraS tuq tlhIngan yejquv patlh luDub 'e' reH lunIDtaH DuraS be'nI'pu' lurSa' be'etor je. ngoQvam luchavmeH ghawran maghpu' be'nI'pu'. woQ luSuqmeH jIjpu' chaH romuluSngan'e' je.:sen:nolink}
  "Сёстры из дома Дюраса, Лурса и Бетор, постоянно ищут высокого положения для дома Дюраса внутри клингонского высшего совета. В конце, сёстры выступили против Гаурона, зайдя так далеко, что работали с ромуланскими группировками, чтобы усилить власть."[2]

notes.en: A "sister-in-law" is {loDnI' be'nal:n@@loDnI':n, be'nal:n} or {be'nI' be'nal:n@@be'nI':n, be'nal:n}.
notes.ru: Золовка будет {loDnI' be'nal:n@@loDnI':n, be'nal:n} или {be'nI' be'nal:n@@be'nI':n, be'nal:n}.

notes.en: A planet in the Federation. Its inhabitants are telepaths.
notes.ru: Планета в составе Федерации. Населена телепатами.

notes.en: {SoH:n}:{pagh:n:1h} = {bI-:v:pref,nolink}

bID:n.hidden_notes: The medical abbreviation "b.i.d.", short for the Latin "bis in die", means "twice a day".

notes.en: For notes on the grammar of this sentence, see {bIjeghbe'chugh vaj bIHegh!:sen}
notes.ru: К примечаниям для грамматики этого предложения, смотрите {bIjeghbe'chugh vaj bIHegh!:sen}

bIghHa':n.hidden_notes: Jail is referred to in slang as the "big house".

examples.en:
▶ {bIghHa'Daq yIghoS:sen:nolink} "Go to jail"[1, p.170]
▶ {bIghHa' yIjaH:sen:nolink} "Go to jail"[2]
examples.ru:
▶ {bIghHa'Daq yIghoS:sen:nolink} "Отправляйся в тюрьму"[1, p.170]
▶ {bIghHa' yIjaH:sen:nolink} "Отправляйся в тюрьму"[2]

notes.en:
To answer in the affirmative, say {HIja':excl} "yes" or {jISop vIneH} "I want to eat."

To answer in the negative, say {ghobe':excl} or {jISop vIneHbe'} "I don't want to eat."
notes.ru:
Чтобы ответить утвердительно, скажите {HIja':excl} "да" или {jISop vIneH} "Я хочу есть."

Чтобы ответить отрицательно, скажите {ghobe':excl} "нет" or {jISop vIneHbe'} "Я не хочу есть."

definition.en: If you are afraid to die, you have already died.
definition.de: Wenn du Angst vor dem Sterben hast, bist du schon gestorben.
definition.ru: Если ты боишься умереть, ты уже умер.

definition.en: If you say the wrong thing, I will kill you.
definition.de: Wenn du etwas Falsches sagst, werde ich dich töten.
definition.ru: Если ты скажешь, что-то не то, я тебя убью.

bIjatlh 'e' yImev!:sen.hidden_notes: This is defined on {TKD p.172:src} as "Be quiet! (i.e., Stop speaking!)", and in {PK:src} as "Shut up!"

notes.en:
This sentence literally means, "If you don't surrender, you will die". Note that even though the English translation has "or" in it, the conjunction {pagh:conj} is not used in the Klingon sentence. In general, English sentences of the form "X or Y!" (demanding that the listener choose one out of the two options) must be recast as {bI-X-be'chugh vaj bI-Y:sen:nolink} "If you don't X, you will Y" in Klingon.

Watch Gowron say this: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/NpFDKTzINH8}

examples.ru:
Это предложение дословно означает, "Если ты не сдашься, то умрешь". Обратите внимание, что союз "или" {pagh:conj} не используется в Клингонском предложении. В общем случае предложения вида "X или Y!" (требование, чтобы слушатель выбрал один из двух вариантов) должны быть переделаны в {bI-X-be'chugh vaj bI-Y:sen:nolink} "Если ты не X, то ты Y" на клингонском.

Смотрите, как это говорит Гаурон: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/NpFDKTzINH8}

notes.en: This is often said by Klingon merchants to their customers. See the similar {bIjeghbe'chugh vaj bIHegh!:sen} for analysis.
notes.ru: Это часто говорят клингонские купцы своим покупателям. См анализ похожего предложения {bIjeghbe'chugh vaj bIHegh!:sen}

definition.en: If you cannot fail, you cannot succeed.
definition.de: Wenn du nicht versagen kannst, kannst du auch keinen Erfolg haben.
definition.ru: Если ты не можешь проиграть, ты не можешь преуспеть.

notes.en: One of the designers of the {BoP:src} poster. See {nIylo roDIS:n:name}.

examples.en: ▶ {lu'oghta' nIylo roDIS bIl jo'rIj je:sen:nolink} "Designed By: Nilo Rodis & Bill George"
examples.ru: ▶ {lu'oghta' nIylo roDIS bIl jo'rIj je:sen:nolink} "Создано: Найло Родисом & Биллом Джорджем"

definition.en: second tone of nonatonic musical scale
definition.sv: andra tonen på den nonatoniska skalan

notes.en: The tones of the Klingon musical scale (see {yutlhegh:n}) are: {yu:n}, {bIm:n:nolink}, {'egh:n}, {loS:n:2}, {vagh:n:2}, {jav:n:2}, {Soch:n:2}, {chorgh:n:2}, {yu:n:nolink}.

bIm:n.hidden_notes: Instead of "ray", which is "a drop of golden sun", this is a "beam".

definition.ru: Никогда не уходи без своего батлета.

definition.en: May you encounter Kahless in your dreams.
definition.de: Mögest du Kahless in deinen Träumen begegnen.
definition.ru: Пусть ты увидишь Кейлеса в твоих снах.

notes.en: See {bIS'ub:n} and {pIrmuS:n} for the bottom parts of an object. See also {lurgh:n} for other words related to spatial directions.

Note that the Klingon word for "hundred thousand" is independent of the words for "hundred" ({vatlh:n}) and "thousand" ({SaD:n}). The Klingon {bIp:n:num,nolink} is equivalent to the "lakh" which is used in South Asian numbering systems on Earth.
notes.ru: Обратите внимание, что клингонское слово для "сотни тысяч" не зависит от слов "сотня" ({vatlh:n}) и "тысяча" ({SaD:n}). Клингонский слово {bIp:n:num,nolink} эквивалент "lakh" которое используетсяв южно-азиатской системе счисления Земли.

notes.en: Water is used as the symbol of weakness and disdain. This idea is expressed in the Klingon idiom {puj; bIQ rur}.
This is a verb with one of each type of suffix. It doesn't really mean anything.
notes.ru: Это глагол с каждым из типов суффиксов. Он ничего не означает.

bIQong'eghqangchoHmoHlaHchu'pu'neSchugh:.hidden_notes: The invention of this verbal phrase is attributed to Mark Shoulson.

notes.en: This word is used for a ship that travels on water.
notes.ru: Это слово используется для корабля, который путешествует по воде.

notes.en: This refers to the room in which Terrans spray themselves with water. (Yuck.)
notes.ru: Это относится к комнате, в которой земляне обрызгивают себя водой. (Мерзость.)

bIQ ghaywI' pa':n.hidden_notes: This is defined in {TNK:src} as "shower", but it clearly refers to the room.

notes.en: Brackish water is the best water for tea.[1, p.96]

definition.en: be quite mistaken, be totally wrong
definition.ru: Быть очень неправым, быть абсолютно неправым

notes.en: This literally means "The cup contains water." It is a reasonably strong expression, and it would not be surprising if a fight broke out after this is uttered.

examples.en: ▶ {bIQ ngaS HIvje'lIj.:sen:nolink} "You're all wrong."

definition.en: To really succeed, you must enjoy eating poison.
definition.de: Um wirklich erfolgreich zu sein, musst du es genießen, Gift zu essen.
definition.ru: Чтобы преуспеть по настоящему, вы должны наслаждаться поеданием яда

notes.en: This covers most animals that live in the sea, such as dolphins, whales, fish, and octopuses, but not smaller animals such as shrimps or water bugs, or amphibians. Every {ghotI':n} is a {bIQDep:n:nolink}, but not every {bIQDep:n:nolink} is a {ghotI':n:nolink}.[2]
notes.ru: Охватывает большинство животных, что живут в море, таких как дельфины, киты, рыба, а также осьминоги, но не животных поменьше таких как креветки или водяные жуки, или амфибии. Каждый {ghotI':n} является {bIQDep:n:nolink}, но не каждый {bIQDep:n:nolink} является {ghotI':n:nolink}.[2]

bIQDep:n.hidden_notes: This was defined as "fish" in {KGT:src}[1], but was clarified to refer to any sea or water-based creature later.[2]

bIQongtaHvIS nItlhejchugh targhmey bIvem.entry_name: bIQongtaHvIS nItlhejchugh targhmey bIvemDI' nItlhej ghIlab ghewmey.

definition.en: If you sleep with targs, you'll wake up with glob flies.
definition.de: Wenn du bei Targs schläfst, wachst du mit Glob-Fliegen auf.
definition.ru: Если ты спишь с таргами, ты проснешься в кругу мух.

notes.en: This literally means "water gas".
notes.ru: Дословное значение "водный газ".

examples.en:
▶ {SIqral bIQtIq:n}[2]
▶ {QIStaq qul bIQtIqHomDaq 'etlhDaj vo' nuch} "The coward throws his sword into the fire streams of Kri'stak"[2]

notes.en: This is a specific type of {chabHom:n} that's sort of two {chabHommey:n:nolink} stuck together like a sandwich.

bIQyIn:n.hidden_notes: "Hydrox" is a brand of cookie sandwich which derives its name from the components of water, hydrogen ({bIQSIp:n}) and oxygen ({yInSIp:n}).

examples.en: ▶ {bIQ'a'Daq 'oHtaH 'etlh'e'.:sen}

definition.en: The sword is in the ocean.

notes.en: This idiom means that something has ended, and it is impossible to return to the previous condition.
notes.ru: Эта идиома означает, что что-либо закончилось, и это невозможно вернуть в предыдущее состояние.

notes.en: This literally means the edge ({HeH:n}) of the ocean ({bIQ'a':n}). A beach by a lake would be called a {ngeng HeH:n}, and so on.
notes.ru: Дословно это означает край ({HeH:n}) океана ({bIQ'a':n}). Пляж у озера можно будет назван {ngeng HeH:n}, и так далее.

notes.en: There is an idiom, {bIr; bortaS rur@@bIr:v, bortaS:n, rur:v}.

bIr:v.hidden_notes: A cold "beer", or alternatively, "brrrr" is the sound one makes when one is cold.

examples.en: ▶ {bortaS bIr jablu'DI' reH QaQqu' nay'.:sen}

definition.en: The blood of the warrior grows cold.
definition.de: Das Blut des Kriegers wird kalt.

notes.en: To discourage romantic attention from someone, turn your side to them, and say this sentence.

definition.en: If the qIvon is cold, the blood is hot.
definition.de: Wenn das Kivon kalt ist, ist das Blut heiß.

notes.en: This is a ceremony in which the killer of the head of a Klingon house marries the widow and becomes the head of the house himself. The language associated with this ceremony is in a form of {no' Hol:n}.[1, p.11]
notes.ru: Это церемония, в которой убийца главы клингонского дома женится на вдове и сам становится главой дома. Язык взаимодействует с этой церемонией в виде {no' Hol:n}.[1, p.11]

notes.en: It is unknown what "bregit" means.
notes.ru: Неизвестно, что данное слово означает.

bIreQ:n.hidden_notes: This word does not appear in canon by itself, but can be inferred from {bIreQtagh:n}.

notes.en: This dish may be made from the breathing organ of any of a number of beasts.[3]

definition.en: If you must negotiate, watch your enemy's eyes.
definition.de: Wenn du verhandeln musst, beobachte die Augen deines Feindes.
definition.ru: Если ты должен вести переговоры, наблюдай за глазами своего врага.

definition.de: Wähle den Kampf, nicht die Verhandlung.

notes.en: For example, this word would be used to describe the inside bottom of a box. The other face of the box's {bIS'ub:n:nolink} is its {pIrmuS:n}.
There is an idiom, {bIt; tI'qa' vIghro' rur@@bIt:v, tI'qa' vIghro':n, rur:v}.[2]
notes.ru: Является идиомой, {bIt; tI'qa' vIghro' rur@@bIt:v, tI'qa' vIghro':n, rur:v}.[2]

bIt:v.hidden_notes: As the saying goes: once bitten, twice shy. On {KGT p.132:src}, the word is written as {tIb:v:nolink} instead of {bIt:v:nolink}, but this is clearly a typo.

definition.en: If you cannot be shamed, you cannot be honored.
definition.de: Nur wer die Schande kennt, kennt auch die Ehre.
definition.ru: Если тебя нельзя посрамить, тебя нельзя почтить.

notes.en: Watch Gowron say this: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/DRVZd0L-hzo}
notes.ru: Смотрите, как это говорит Гаурон: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/DRVZd0L-hzo}

notes.en: Watch Gowron say this: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/AcgPCgDUYwI}
notes.ru: Смотрите, как это говорит Гаурон: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/AcgPCgDUYwI}

definition.en: You do not deserve to live.
definition.de: Du verdienst es nicht, zu leben.

bIyIntaH 'e' Daqotlhbe'.:sen.hidden_notes: This sentence is spoken in Klingon in the opening sequence to {PK:src}, but no English translation is provided.

notes.en: There is an idiomatic expression, {pe'vIl bI'chu':sen} "forcefully sweep away", which means to do something all at once, as a single event.[1, p.112]
notes.ru: Идиоматическое выражение, {pe'vIl bI'chu':sen} "мощно вымести", которое означает сделать что-либо однажды, как единичное событие.[1, p.112]

examples.en: ▶ {romuluSnganpu' Dujmey DIQaw'pu'; pe'vIl DIbI'chu'pu'.} "We destroyed the Romulans' ships all at once."
examples.ru: ▶ {romuluSnganpu' Dujmey DIQaw'pu'; pe'vIl DIbI'chu'pu'.} "Мы уничтожили ромуланские корабли все разом."

bI'IHqu'.:sen.hidden_notes: This sentence doesn't appear in canon. It is here for symmetry with {bImoHqu'.:sen}

notes.en:
To answer in the affirmative, say {HIja':excl} "yes" or {jItlhutlh vIneH} "I want to drink."

To answer in the negative, say {ghobe':excl} or {jItlhutlh vIneHbe'} "I don't want to drink."

examples.ru:
Чтобы ответить утвердительно,скажите {HIja':excl} "да" или {jItlhutlh vIneH} "Я хочу пить."

Чтобы ответить отрицательно, скажите {ghobe':excl} "нет" или {jItlhutlh vIneHbe'} "Я не хочу пить."

definition.en: beginning (of an opera, play, story, speech)
definition.sv: inledning, början (på sång, pjäs, historia, etc.)

notes.en: This refers to the opening section of a performance (first act, scene, sentence, etc.).
notes.ru: Это относится к начальному разделу представления (первый акт, сцена, предложение, и т.д.).

bI'reS:n.hidden_notes: These are the first two syllables of the Torah.

examples.en: ▶ {bI'reS qeylIS vaq molor:sen:nolink} "First, Molor taunts Kahless"[2]
examples.ru: ▶ {bI'reS qeylIS vaq molor:sen:nolink} "Сначала Молор насмехается над Кейлесом"[2]

notes.en:
{tlhIH:n}:{ghaH:n}/{'oH:n}/{chaH:n}/{bIH:n} = {bo-:v:pref,nolink}

When used with {-lu':v}, this prefix means "Someone (indefinite subject) does something to you (plural)".
notes.ru:
{tlhIH:n}:{ghaH:n}/{'oH:n}/{chaH:n}/{bIH:n} = {bo-:v:pref,nolink}

Использование префикса совместно с {-lu':v}, означает "Кто-то (неопределенный) делает что-то вам (множственное число)".

notes.en: There is an idiom, {boch; ghIch rur}.[2, p.133]
notes.ru: Это идиома, {boch; ghIch rur}.[2, p.133]

examples.en: ▶ {ghIchwIj DabochmoHchugh ghIchlIj qanob.:sen}

notes.en: This is derived from an earlier expression {'etlh bochmoHwI':n:nolink}.
notes.ru: Получено из более раннего выражения {'etlh bochmoHwI':n:nolink}.

definition.en: Klingons are born, live as warriors, then die.
definition.de: Klingonen werden geboren, werden zu Kriegern und sterben dann.
definition.ru: Клингоны рождаются, живут как воины, а затем умирают

bol:v:1.hidden_notes: It is explicitly stated on {KGT p.147:src} that the non-slang meaning of this verb does not take an object.

bol:v:2.hidden_notes: The slang definition of this verb appears in the discussion on {bolwI':n} on {KGT p.147:src}, but is not found in the word lists in that book. This is the reverse of {lob:v}.

bolwI':n.hidden_notes: Possibly from "boll weevil", from American Civil War history.

notes.en: Kinds of {bom:n:nolink} include: {bang bom:n}, {HIvje' bom:n}, {van bom:n}, {chon bom:n}, {Dap bom:n}, {ghe'naQ:n}, {may' bom:n}, {najmoHwI':n}.
notes.ru: Виды {bom:n:nolink} включают: {bang bom:n}, {HIvje' bom:n}, {van bom:n}, {chon bom:n}, {Dap bom:n}, {ghe'naQ:n}, {may' bom:n}, {najmoHwI':n}.

examples.en: ▶ {ta'mey Dun, bommey Dun.:sen}

notes.en: {bom:n}, {much:v}, {wup:v}, {QoQ:n}

examples.en: ▶ {bomDI' 'IwwIj qaqaw.:sen}

definition.en: The memory of you sings in my blood.
definition.de: Die Erinnerung an dich singt in meinem Blut.
definition.ru: Память о том, как ты поёшь, в моей крови.

notes.en: There is a Klingon idiom, {'oj; bomwI' rur@@'oj:v, bomwI':n, rur:v}.
notes.ru: Клингонская идиома, {'oj; bomwI' rur@@'oj:v, bomwI':n, rur:v}.

notes.en: When {A:sen:nolink} shares {C:sen:nolink} with {B:sen:nolink}, the construction is {B-vaD C bon A:sen:nolink} (with appropriate verb prefixes depending on {A:sen:nolink} and {C:sen:nolink}). In this case, {C:sen:nolink} belongs to {A:sen:nolink} and {A:sen:nolink} chooses to share it with {B:sen:nolink}.
notes.ru: Когда {A:sen:nolink} делит {C:sen:nolink} с {B:sen:nolink}, конструкция следующая {B-vaD C bon A:sen:nolink} (с подходящими глагольными префиксами, зависящими от {A:sen:nolink} и {C:sen:nolink}). В этом случае, {C:sen:nolink} принадлежит к {A:sen:nolink} и {A:sen:nolink} решает поделиться этим с {B:sen:nolink}.

bon:v.hidden_notes: Reverse of {nob:v}. This was apparently not intentional.

definition.ru: Быть о чём-то(о ком-то), быть обеспокоенным

bop:v.hidden_notes: The refrain to the Hokey Pokey, "that's what it's all about", is {'e' bop:sen:nolink} in Klingon.

examples.en: ▶ {HolQeD bopbe' paqvam.:sen@@HolQeD:n, bop:v, -be':v, paq:n:1h, -vam:n} "This book is not about linguistics."
examples.ru: ▶ {HolQeD bopbe' paqvam.:sen@@HolQeD:n, bop:v, -be':v, paq:n:1h, -vam:n} "Эта книга не о лингвистике."

notes.en: This is a physics term.
notes.ru: Это физический термин.

definition.en: ally with, form an alliance with; add (used in math)
definition.de: sich verbünden mit, eine Allianz formen; plus (in der Mathematik)
definition.sv: alliera med, förena med, skapa en allians med
definition.ru: Вступать в союз с, заключать альянс с, добавлять(используется в математике)

notes.en: The four basic arithmetic operations are: + {boq:v:nolink}, - {boqHa':v}, × {boq'egh:v}, ÷ {boqHa''egh:v}. In these operations, numbers are treated as if they are grammatically singular.
notes.ru: 4 базовые арифеметические операции: + {boq:v:nolink}, - {boqHa':v}, × {boq'egh:v}, ÷ {boqHa''egh:v}. В этих операциях числа трактуются так, как если бы они были в единственном числе.

examples.en: ▶ {wej boq loS; chen Soch:sen:nolink} 4 + 3 = 7
▶ {loS boqHa' wej; chen wa':sen:nolink} 4 - 3 = 1

▶ {cha'logh boq'egh wej; chen jav:sen:nolink} 2 x 3 = 6
▶ {pIraqSIS HoS waw' ghajlu'chugh, loSlogh boq'egh mI' naghmey mI'; chen qav'ap.:sen:nolink} "If Praxis Energy Facility is owned, rent is 4 times amount shown on dice."
▶ {wejlogh boqHa''egh jav; chen cha':sen:nolink} 6 / 3 = 2

notes.en: Its livers are eaten as {boqrat chej Qevlu'pu'bogh:n@@boqrat:n, chej:n, Qev:v, -lu':v, -pu':v, -bogh:v} "stewed bokrat liver".

boqrat:n.hidden_notes: {boqrat chej:n:nolink} is listed in the glossary to {Diplomatic Implausibility:src}.

notes.en: This refers to a person who assists someone.
notes.ru: Это относится к человеку, который помогает кому-то.

boQ:n:1.hidden_notes: Marc Okrand ({marq 'oqranD:n:name}) is billed as Associate Producer, translated as {chenmoHwI' boQ@@chenmoHwI':n, boQ:n:1}, in the film {Conlanging:src}.

notes.en: This would be used in situations where someone might be able to do a task alone, but it's easier or better or more efficient if someone helps out. The object of {boQ:v:nolink} retains the responsibility for the activity being aided. This is in contrast to {QaH:v}.[2]
notes.ru: Это следует использовать в ситуациях, когда кто-то может сделать задание в одиночку, но проще или лучше или более эффективно, если кто-то поможет. Объект {boQ:v:nolink} сохраняет  ответственность за оказанную помощь. Это контрастирует с {QaH:v}.[2]

notes.en:
{tlhIngan Hol boQwI':n:nolink} "Klingon Language Assistant" - database version [[VERSION]].

To begin searching, simply press the "Search" (magnifying glass) button and type into the search box.

To hear the sounds of Klingon, you need to install a {Text-To-Speech engine:url:https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.tlhInganHol.android.klingonttsengine}.

It is recommended to install the {Klingon Keyboard for ASK:url:https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.anysoftkeyboard.languagepack.tlhIngan}. Otherwise, to make it easier to type Klingon on a mobile keyboard, the following shorthand (called "xifan hol") can be enabled under the Preferences menu:
    c ▶ {ch:sen:nolink} / d ▶ {D:sen:nolink} / f ▶ {ng:sen:nolink} / g ▶ {gh:sen:nolink} / h ▶ {H:sen:nolink} /
    i ▶ {I:sen:nolink} / k ▶ {Q:sen:nolink} / s ▶ {S:sen:nolink} / x ▶ {tlh:sen:nolink} / z ▶ {':sen:nolink}
It is also possible to choose the alternate keymapping:
    k ▶ {q:sen:nolink} / q ▶ {Q:sen:nolink}

If you encounter any problems, or have any suggestions, please send me an {email at De.vID.jonpIn@gmail.com:url:mailto:De.vID.jonpIn@gmail.com?subject=boQwI%27%20feedback&body=Device:%20%0D%0AAndroid%20version:%20%0D%0A}.

Please support the Klingon language by purchasing {The Klingon Dictionary:src}, {Klingon for the Galactic Traveler:src}, {The Klingon Way:src}, {Conversational Klingon:src}, {Power Klingon:src}, and other Klingon- and Star Trek-related products from Pocket Books, Simon & Schuster, and Paramount/Viacom/CBS Entertainment.

Klingon, Star Trek, and related marks are trademarks of CBS Studios, Inc., and are used under "fair use" guidelines.

Android programming: {De'vID:n:name}
Flutter (iOS) port: Daniel Dadap
Klingon-English data: {De'vID:n:name,nolink}, with help from others
German translations: {Quvar:n:name} (Lieven L. Litaer)
Swedish translations: {Klingonska Akademien:url:http://klingonska.org/}
TNG {pIqaD:n} font: Admiral {qurgh lungqIj:n:name,nolink} of the {Klingon Assault Group:url:http://www.kag.org/}
DSC {pIqaD:n:nolink} font: {Quvar:n:name,nolink} (Lieven L. Litaer)

Special thanks to Marc Okrand ({marq 'oqranD:n:name}) for creating the Klingon language.
notes.de:
{tlhIngan Hol boQwI':n:nolink} "Klingonisch-Assistent" - Datenbank Version [[VERSION]].

Um eine Suche zu starten, Klicke auf das Suchsymbol (die Lupe) und gib etwas in das Suchfeld ein.

Um die klingonischen Wörter zu hören, muss die {Vorlesesoftware:url:https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.tlhInganHol.android.klingonttsengine} installiert werden.

Es wird empfohlen, die {klingonische Tastatur für ASK:url:https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.anysoftkeyboard.languagepack.tlhIngan} zu installieren. Um auf einer kleinen Tastatur einfacher Klingonisch einzugeben, kann in den Einstellungen die folgende vereinfachte Eingabemethode ("xifan hol" genannt) aktiviert werden:
    c ▶ {ch:sen:nolink} / d ▶ {D:sen:nolink} / f ▶ {ng:sen:nolink} / g ▶ {gh:sen:nolink} / h ▶ {H:sen:nolink} /
    i ▶ {I:sen:nolink} / k ▶ {Q:sen:nolink} / s ▶ {S:sen:nolink} / x ▶ {tlh:sen:nolink} / z ▶ {':sen:nolink}
Zusätzlich kann auch die folgende Tastenbelegung ausgewählt werden:
    k ▶ {q:sen:nolink} / q ▶ {Q:sen:nolink}

Bei Problemen oder Vorschlägen, sende bitte eine {E-Mail an De.vID.jonpIn@gmail.com:url:mailto:De.vID.jonpIn@gmail.com?subject=boQwI%27%20feedback&body=Device:%20%0D%0AAndroid%20version:%20%0D%0A}.

Bitte unterstütze die klingonische Sprache durch den Erwerb der Bücher {The Klingon Dictionary:src}, {Klingon for the Galactic Traveler:src}, {The Klingon Way:src}, {Conversational Klingon:src}, {Power Klingon:src}, sowie der anderen Klingonen- oder Star-Trek-bezogenen Produkte von Pocket Books, Simon & Schuster, und Paramount/Viacom/CBS Entertainment.

Klingon, Star Trek, und verwandte Begriffe sind Schutzmarken von CBS Studios, Inc., und werden unter "fair use" verwendet.

Android Programmierung: {De'vID:n:name}
Flutter (iOS) Portierung: Daniel Dadap
Klingonisch-Englische Informationen: {De'vID:n:name,nolink}, mit Unterstützung von Anderen
Deutsche Übersetzung: {Quvar:n:name} (Lieven L. Litaer)
Schwedische Übersetzung: {Klingonska Akademien:url:http://klingonska.org/}
TNG {pIqaD:n} Schriftart: Admiral {qurgh lungqIj:n:name,nolink} von der {Klingon Assault Group:url:http://www.kag.org/}
DSC {pIqaD:n:nolink} Schriftart: {Quvar:n:name,nolink} (Lieven L. Litaer)

Ein besonderer Dank richtet sich an Marc Okrand ({marq 'oqranD:n:name}) für das Erschaffen der klingonischen Sprache.

notes.en: This specifically refers to the sound that a stomach makes.
notes.de: Dies ähnelt dem Geräusch, das der Magen macht.
notes.ru: Относится к звукам, которые издаёт живот.

bor:v.hidden_notes: "Borborygmus" is an onomatopoetic word referring to the rumbling sound made by intestinal gas.

notes.en: The non-slang way to say "thunder" is {tuD:v}.
notes.de: Der Standardausdruck für "donnern" ist {tuD:v}.
notes.ru: Безсленговый способ сказать "гром", это {tuD:v}.

definition.en: a very small bird whose eggs are considered quite tasty
definition.de: ein sehr kleiner Vogel dessen Eier als sehr schmackhaft gelten
definition.sv: ett slags fågel (väldigt liten, dess ägg anses mycket goda)
definition.ru: Название очень маленькой птицы, чьи яйца считаются довольно вкусными

notes.en: There is an idiom, {bIr; bortaS rur@@bIr:v, bortaS:n, rur:v}.
notes.de: Es gibt die Redewendung {bIr; bortaS rur@@bIr:v, bortaS:n, rur:v}.
notes.ru: Есть идиома, {bIr; bortaS rur@@bIr:v, bortaS:n, rur:v}.

examples.en:
▶ {bortaS nIvqu' 'oH bortaS'e'.:sen}
▶ {bortaS bIr jablu'DI' reH QaQqu' nay'.:sen}

bortaS bIr jablu'DI' reH QaQqu' nay'.:se.entry_name: bortaS bIr jablu'DI' reH QaQqu' nay'.

definition.en: Revenge is a dish which is best served cold.
definition.de: Rache wird am besten kalt serviert.
definition.ru: Месть это блюдо, которое подают холодным.

notes.en:
This is a very famous Klingon proverb.

There is also a related idiom {bIr; bortaS rur@@bIr:v, bortaS:n, rur:v}.
notes.ru:
Очень известная клингонская поговорка.

Также есть связанная идиома {bIr; bortaS rur@@bIr:v, bortaS:n, rur:v}.

bot:v.hidden_notes: The German word for "forbidden" is ver"bot"en.

examples.en:
▶ {Dubotchugh yIpummoH.:sen}[2]

notes.ru: Это слово относится к силовому полю ({Surchem:n}) окружающему корабль. Для щитов, которые держат в руке, смотрите {yoD:n}.

definition.de: Kelle (Schaufelwerkzeug, ähnlich einer Gartenkelle, um Nahrung aus einem Topf zu entnehmen)

notes.en:

Используется для удаления еды из {'un:n}.

notes.en: This expression has the negative connotation of exaggerating when it is inappropriate to do so.

bo'Degh:n.hidden_notes: The Alfred Hitchcock movie "The Birds" takes place in Bodega Bay.

bo'voD:n.hidden_notes: "Drawer" is slang for "underwear", and "BVD" is a brand of men's underwear.

buq:n.hidden_notes:
The Klingon Dictionary was published by Pocket Books. See also {paq:n:1h}.

The 2009 {Star Trek:src} movie has a deleted scene with the line: {buqmeylIjDaq DIvI' De' pu'jInmey... 'ach pu'jInmeylIj bIHbe'.:sen:nolink}

notes.en: This word refers to an internal organ, of which Klingons have two (see {bIraqlul:n}). To refer to the exterior midsection of the body, use {chor:n:1} instead.

notes.ru: Это слово относится ко внутреннему органу, коих у Клингонов два (see {bIraqlul:n}). Чтобы сослаться на внешнюю сторону тела, используйте {chor:n:1} вместо этого.

This literally means "new pie". This slang term derives from the similarity in the {Qotmagh Sep:n} dialect of {chab:n:1} to {cham:n}.

definition.de: Wunsch, etwas das man sich wünscht

chach:n.hidden_notes: This was originally defined as "emergency" in {TKD:src}, and its meaning was then expanded to include "auxiliary, backup" in a vocabulary list first published in {veS QonoS:src} then reprinted in {HQ 1.3, Sept. 1992:src}. Note that a noun-noun construction containing {chach:n:nolink} might have a different meaning depending on whether {chach:n:nolink} is the first or second noun in the compound.

examples.en:

▶ {chach Duj:n}

definition.en: close female friend of a female
definition.sv: väninna, nära kvinnlig vän till en kvinna

notes.en: This word is used by one female in addressing another female who is a close friend. Use of this word in other contexts may be considered insulting or offensive. It is not uncommon for a Klingon mother to address her daughter as {chaj:n:nolink}, but not the other way around.

chal:n.hidden_notes: In the novel {Sarek:src}, {chal:n:nolink} is also the name of a type of flower.

notes.en: This would be used, for example, to refer to a puddle on the ground and it was necessary to be clear that the puddle resulted from rain. Otherwise, the water would just be {bIQ:n} (perhaps with some modifier or other).
notes.de: Damit könnte man das Wasser in einer Pfütze beschreiben, um deutlich zu machen, dass es nicht etwas anderes ist. Ansonsten ist es einfach nur {bIQ:n} (evtl. mit einem anderen Zusatz).

examples.en: ▶ {chalqach rachlu'ta'bogh:n:nolink} "fortified tower"[2]

notes.en: A planet in the Romulan Star Empire.

chaltoq loS:n.hidden_notes: The fact that the name of this planet appears to be "inhabited sky" in Klingon (see {chal:n}, {toq:v}) seems to be a coincidence.

definition.en: area eastward, area towards the east

notes.en: This is in the direction of the sunrise.[1] It is 90 degrees on a Terran compass, if north is 0 and degrees are counted clockwise.

chan:n.hidden_notes: China is in the east (from the perspective of Europe or America).

notes.en: This is kept in a large {bal:n}.
This is a regional word for {qettlhup:n}.

chang'eng:n.hidden_notes: Chang and Eng Bunker were a famous pair of Siamese twins.

examples.en:

▶ {nISwI' - cha' chang'engmey (telDaq lujomlu', nItebHa' lubaHlu'):sen:nolink} "Disruptor - 2 pairs (Wing Mounted, Fire Linked)[1]

chap:n.hidden_notes: It's quite common for the backs of one's hands to become "chap"ped.

notes.de: Siehe wie Gowron dies sagt: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/8Rg12lJheMc}

definition.en: top of walking cane or ceremonial cane

notes.en: This contains less liquid than found in what a Terran might identify as soup. It is served in a {maHpIn:n}, and eaten in a {Duq:n}.

chatlh:n:1.hidden_notes: The fact that this is eaten in a {Duq:n:nolink} may be a reference to the Marx Brothers film "Duck Soup".

chatlh:n:2.hidden_notes: The slang meaning may be a reference to the Marx Brothers film "Duck Soup".

notes.en:
This is an exclamation made in response to a statement which the speaker thinks is foolish or stupid. (The exclamation {Dap!:sen:nolink} using the non-slang word {Dap:n} is also possible, though less likely.)

If the speaker is referring to something that's happened which is a stupid thing to have happened (but really did happen, so that it's not a nonsensical statement), {chatlh:sen:nolink} or {Dap:sen:nolink} would not be used. Instead, a version of the idiomatic expressions {ghaH vuv SuS neH:sen} or {Dogh; tIghla' rur:sen@@Dogh:v, tIghla':n, rur:v} might be heard:
▶ {vuvpu' SuS neH vay'!:sen:nolink} "That's stupid!", "someone wanted the wind to respect him/her"
▶ {vogh tIghla' tu'lu':sen:nolink} "there's a t'gla somewhere"
▶ {HIv tIghla'!:sen:nolink} "a/the t'gla attacks"
notes.de:
Dies ist ein Ausruf der als Antwort zu einer Aussage getätigt wird, von welcher der Sprecher glaubt, sie sei unsinnig oder dumm. (Der Ausruf {Dap!:sen:nolink} mit dem Standard-Wort {Dap:n} ist dafür auch geeignet, aber seltener.)

Falls der Sprecher auf ein unsinniges Ereignis deutet (und dieses auch wirklich vorgefallen ist), dann werden {chatlh:sen:nolink} und {Dap:sen:nolink} nicht benutzt. Stattdessen hört man hier häufig Abwandlungen der Redewendungen {ghaH vuv SuS neH:sen} und {Dogh; tIghla' rur:sen@@Dogh:v, tIghla':n, rur:v}:
▶ {vuvpu' SuS neH vay'!:sen:nolink} "Das ist doch bescheuert!", "Da wollte jemand, dass der Wind ihn/sie respektiert."
▶ {vogh tIghla' tu'lu':sen:nolink} "Da ist irgendwo ein T'gla."
▶ {HIv tIghla'!:sen:nolink} "Der/Ein T'gla greift an."

examples.en: ▶ {QaghwIj vIQIj 'e' yIchaw'neS.} "Permit me to explain my mistake, your honor."[2]

notes.en:
This word is used for a broader range of objects than the translation "permit" suggests. Kinds of {chaw':n:nolink} include {HIjmeH chaw':n}, {Huch chaw':n}, {leng chaw':n}, {lojmIt chaw':n:nolink}, {yer ghajwI' chaw':n}, and {'elmeH chaw':n}. Thus, {chaw':n:nolink} can also mean "ticket", "pass", or "license".

A {chaw':n:nolink} shows that you are officially or legally allowed to do or get or own something, whereas a {Qoyje':n} serves as proof or verification of some sort of achievement or accomplishment.[3]

chaw':n.hidden_notes: This is missing from the K-E side of {TKD:src}.

examples.en: ▶ {chay' jura'?:sen}

definition.en: How did this happen? What's going on?
How do I use this? What do I do with this?
definition.de: Wie benutze ich das? Was mache ich damit?

notes.en: This literally means "How do you (sing.) command us?"

cha':v.hidden_notes: The first ever line of Klingon spoken on-screen was {wIy cha':sen@@wIy:n, cha':v}, in {Star Trek I:src}.

examples.en:
▶ {wIy yIcha'!:sen}
▶ {tlhIngan Dujmey law'qu' SommeyDaq batlh cha'lu'.@@tlhIngan:n, Duj:n:1, -mey:n, law':v, -qu':v, Som:n, -mey:n, -Daq:n, batlh:adv, cha':v, -lu':v} "[It] has been emblazoned upon the hulls of countless Klingon Starships."[3]

definition.en: a bird noted for its speed
definition.sv: en slags fågel (berömd för sin snabbhet)

notes.en: During some legal proceedings, the accused must have a second to defend him or her.

definition.en: a species of Klingon bird about which little is known
definition.de: Klingonischer Vogel über den wenig bekannt ist
definition.sv: en slags fågel (om vilken litet är känt)

notes.en: Klingons have twenty-three ribs ({joQ:n:1,body}). This expression means that something is not quite right.

examples.en:
▶ {naDev cha'maH cha' joQDu' tu'lu':sen:nolink} (this means something strange is going on)
▶ {cha'maH cha' joQDu' ghaj qama':sen:nolink} "The prisoner has twenty-two ribs", i.e., he's a bit strange

cha'maH vagh vatlhvI' Hong, QIt yIghoS.:.entry_name: cha'maH vagh vatlhvI' Hong, QIt yIghoS.

definition.en: a small bird which digs up bugs to eat
definition.de: kleiner Vogel welcher Käfer zur Nahrung ausgräbt
definition.sv: en slags fågel (liten, gräver upp småkryp att äta)

cha'neH:n.hidden_notes: Pun: "forearms" sounds like "four arms", but there are only two ({cha':n:num}, {neH:adv}).

definition.en: a bird noted for its song
definition.sv: en slags fågel (berömd för sin sång)

cha'par:n.hidden_notes:
This is a reference to Charlie Parker, an American Jazz musician known by the nickname "Yardbird", or "Bird" for short.

Also, in Spanish, "parpar" is the sound made by a duck.

examples.en:
▶ {cha'puj tlhIlHal vISuch vIneH.} "I want to visit the dilithium mines."[2]
▶ {cha'puj vIngevmeH chaw' HInobneS.} "Give me a permit to sell dilithium, your honor."[3]
▶ {yuQ SumDaq cha'puj law' Datu'.} "Detect large sums of dilithium on nearby planet."[4]

notes.en: Crude dilithium crystal is called {Dom:n}.[1] Chrystalline dilithium is used as the reaction moderating element ({choH lISbogh Hap'e':n}) in a Klingon Bird of Prey.[2] The verb {chIm:v} is used for a drained dilithium crystal.[3]

examples.en:
▶ {cha'pujqutmey vIje' vIneHbej!} "I definitely want to buy dilithium crystals!"[4]
▶ {cha'pujqutmey chIm lutamlu'.} "Drained dilithium crystals are replaced."[3]

definition.en: a bird with a noisy, repetitive cry
definition.sv: en slags fågel (med ett högljutt, enformigt skrik)

cha'qu':n.hidden_notes: A "cuckoo", as in a cuckoo clock.

notes.en: This ale is too potent for tourists.
Note that this word is singular, unlike the English word "scissors".
This literally means "we hit targets". Note that {DoSmey:n:nolink} must be used, not the inherently plural {ray':n}. This idiom can be shortened to just {DoSmey DIqIp.:sen:nolink}

This idiomatic expression means that two people are involved in a single activity and no one else is. For example, a duel may be described by saying {Suv cha' qabDu':sen:nolink} "Two faces are fighting", "Two people are fighting one-on-one".
{tlhIH:n}:{maH:n:1h} = {che-:v:pref,nolink}

definition.en: unit of weight, mass (approx. 5 lbs or 2.25 kg)

cheb:n.hidden_notes: Since gravity on Kronos is different than that on Earth, it's not really clear what the exact value of this unit is, or whether it measures weight or mass.

notes.en: According to the {BoP:src} poster, 8.7KT = 375 000 {cheb'a':n:nolink}. It is likely that one {cheb'a':n:nolink} is equal to nine {cheb:n:nolink}.
An alcoholic beverage best served heated and steaming.[1] Its name appears to be composed of {chech:v} and {tlhutlh:v}.[2]

chechtlhutlh:n.hidden_notes: In the K-E side, this is given as "baceh'tluth". This is commonly assumed to be a typo, or perhaps a joke.

notes.en: The object is the place to which the subject returns (if it is not mentioned, the verb takes a prefix indicating no object). If the return is forced, use {tatlh'egh:v} instead.[5]

examples.en:
▶ {ghorgh pa'wIjDaq jIchegh?@@ghorgh:ques, pa':n:1, -wIj:n, -Daq:n, jI-:v, chegh:v} "When can I return to my room?"[2]
▶ {wa'leS jIchegh.} "Tomorrow I will return."[3]
▶ {DaH machegh.}[4]

The following four examples illustrate the role of the object(s) and how to use {chegh:v:nolink} with {-Daq:n} and {-vo':n}[5]:
▶ {lupDujHomDaq jIchegh.:sen:nolink} "I return on the shuttle."
▶ {lupDujHom vIchegh.:sen:nolink} "I return to the shuttle."
▶ {lupDujHomDaq may'Duj vIchegh.:sen:nolink} "I return to the battle cruiser on the shuttle"
▶ {tera'vo' Qo'noS vIchegh.:sen:nolink} "I return to Kronos from Earth"
▶ {wa'leS jIcheH.:sen:nolink} "Tomorrow I will defect."[2]

notes.en: Klingons have two livers.[1, p.28] (See also {bIraqlul:n}.)
For the mathematical operation of addition, see {boq:v}.
Klingon women make sounds like a {chemvaH:n:nolink} to indicate interest in a potential mate.[2]

definition.sv: bygga upp, bildas, formas, ta form, anta skepnad

notes.en: This verb is also used to indicate the result of mathematical operations.[2]
This is the verb {chen:v} with the suffix {-moH:v}, so verb suffixes of types 1 to 3 need to go before {-moH:v}, which is type 4.[2]

examples.en: ▶ {vIchennISmoH.:sen:nolink} "I need to create it."[2]

notes.en: General Chang ({cheng Sa':n:nolink}) was a character in {Star Trek VI:src}.

Note that this is a verb in Klingon. In Klingon, one says "it tornadoes", similar to how one says "it rains" in English.

The verb {ver:v:1} can also be used to talk about tornadoes and whirlwinds.
notes.de: Das Verb {ver:v:1} kann auch benutzen werden um über Tornados und Wirbelstürme zu sprechen.

cheqotlhchugh maHaghbe''a'? cheDuQchugh.entry_name: cheqotlhchugh maHaghbe''a'? cheDuQchugh mareghbe''a'? cheQIHchugh manoDbe''a'?

definition.en: Tickle us, do we not laugh? Prick us, do we not bleed? Wrong us, shall we not seek revenge?
definition.de: Wenn ihr uns kitzelt, lachen wir nicht? Wenn ihr uns stecht, bluten wir nicht? Wenn ihr uns beleidigt, sollen wir uns nicht rächen?

notes.en: This is a paraphrase of a famous passage from Shakespeare's {The Merchant of Venice:src}, Act III, scene i.

cher:v.hidden_notes: This word sounds like "chair", but {che':v} is closer in meaning to "chair".

notes.en: This is an animal with long ears, similar to an Earth rabbit.
In the dialect of {voSpegh Sep:n}, this refers to any coat or jacket (what other Klingons would call a {wep:n:1}).

There is an idiom, {lo'laHbe'; chetvI' chIm rur}.

The distinction between a {chetvI':n:nolink} and a {DuS:n} has to do with how the projectile is loaded.[2]
This is a stick with a hook at the end, which is used as an aid in throwing (see {wob:v}) a {tlhevjaQ:n}.

chetvI':n:2.hidden_notes: This item, as described in {KGT:src}, would seem to be an "atlatl".

examples.en: ▶ {'uSDaj chop, chev!:sen:nolink} "Bite his/her leg off!"[2]

definition.sv: regera, styra, härska, leda, presidera, sitta ordförande

che':v.hidden_notes:
This almost sounds like "chair".

This word is defined in {TKD:src} as "rule, reign, run" and additionally in {KGT:src} as "preside".

examples.en:
▶ {juHqo'Daq vaS'a' tu'lu'. ngoch luchermeH 'ej wo' San luwuqmeH pa' ghom tlhIngan yejquv DevwI'pu'. DaH che' ghawran. yejquv DevwI' moj ghawran 'e' wuqta' cho' 'oDwI' Dapu'bogh janluq pIqarD HoD.:sen:nolink}
  "On the Homeworld, there is a great hall where the leaders of the Klingon High Council meet to determine policy and decide upon the fate of the Empire. Gowron currently presides, named leader of the High Council by Captain Jean-Luc Picard, who was acting as Arbiter of Succession."[3]

che'ron:n.hidden_notes: "Cheron" was the name of the planet in {TOS - Let That Be Your Last Battlefield:src}.

examples.en: ▶ {QaghmeylIj tIchID, yIyoH.:sen}

definition.en: lose, misplace, be unable to find, lose track of

notes.en:
The idiomatic expression {DoS chIl:sen:idiom} means "to digress", e.g., {DoS vIchIl:sen:nolink} means "I digress".[2]

While both {DaHjaj:n:nolink} and {jajvam:n} mean "today", they are not quite interchangeable. {DaHjaj:n:nolink} (but not {jajvam:n:nolink}) is used as the time element in a sentence: {DaHjaj romuluSngan vIHoHpu':sen:nolink} "today I killed a Romulan".[2]

As the subject of a sentence, {jajvam:n:nolink} is more typically found, though {DaHjaj:n:nolink} is not impossible. Compare:
▶ {nI' jajvam:sen:nolink} "this day is long"
▶ {nI' DaHjaj:sen:nolink} "today is long"[2]

{DaHjaj:n:nolink} also behaves as a noun in such noun-noun constructions as {DaHjaj gheD:n} "today's prey", a term often heard in Klingon restaurants with a meaning comparable to "catch of the day".[2]

{DaHjaj:n:nolink} is also used with words indicating a time of day to refer to that portion of the current day. For example, {DaHjaj ram:n}, literally "today's night", means "tonight".[2]

As a time element, {DaHjaj:n} precedes any adverbials.[1, sec. 6.7]

definition.en: dish in a restaurant, "catch of the day"

notes.en:
In Klingon, this is a command rather than a question. It literally means, "Identify the place where you live!"[1]

An acceptable way to phrase this demand as a question is {nuq DaDab?:sen:nolink}[1]

To answer in the affirmative, say {luq:excl} "okay".

To answer in the negative, say {Qo':excl} "no, I refuse".

In the Terran retelling of {Hamlet:src}, the titular character is the prince of this country on Earth.
She is a member of the House of D'Ghor ({Daghor tuq:n:name}).
The suffix for the plural of this word depends on whether it is used to refer to beings capable of using language (see {-pu':n:suff}) or beings incapable of using language (see {-mey:n:suff}).
This verb is also used idiomatically, so that for example {Deq SuvwI'@@Deq:v, SuvwI':n} is similar to the English expression "That warrior is history".
