This is a hypothetical component that is found in {pemjep:n} and {ramjep:n:1}.
This element is not known to exist by itself, but it is found in {jonpIn:n}, {jonta':n}, and {jonwI':n}.
This literally means "I am ready to take a chance." This phrase is associated with the popular search engine {Google:url:http://www.google.com/}.
This term is seen on a sign in a food stall, which Lt. Ash Tyler translated as "space whale". It refers to the {ghormaghenDer:n}.
Consider using the suffix {-qu':v:suff}.

loQHa':adv.hidden_notes: This word does not appear in canon. This entry is here for ease of reference only.

notes.en: This is the name of a female in the Duolingo Klingon course.

definition.en: Maktag, name of a month or season?
definition.de: Maktag, Name eines Monats oder Jahreszeit?

notes.en: Alexander Rozhenko was born on the 43rd day of Maktag.

maqtagh:n.hidden_notes: The Klingon way of writing this name was never given. The script only says "Maktag".

notes.en: This word appears in the {Star Trek - Prey:src} trilogy by John Jackson Miller. It is said to be an "old concept", in which rivals who ally in battle for a time celebrate a temporary truce after a successful joint action, before returning to hostilities.

This word appears in the glossary to {Enemy Territory:src}, where it is described as a "sex aid". It is unclear as to whether it refers to a specific object, a class of objects, or even what it is in general.
According to the {Haynes BoP Manual:src}, this is a type of torpedo carried on the {bI'rel tlharghDuj:n} and {vorcha':n} classes of ships.
This is a hypothetical component that is found in {loDnal:n}, {be'nal:n}, {nalqaD:n}, as well as {'e'nal:n}. According to {KCD:src}, {nal:n:hyp,nolink} is not used as a word on its own.
According to the {Haynes BoP Manual:src}, this is a kind of ordnance carried by a Bird of Prey ({toQDuj:n}) which can be deployed either as a short-range torpedo or as a mine distribution system.
According to the glossary to {Honor Bound:src}, this is a type of lubricant used on disruptor cannons.
According to the {Haynes BoP Manual:src}, this is the standard torpedo type carried on the Bird of Prey ({toQDuj:n}).
Kinds of {pa'mey:n:nolink} include {yaS pa'mey:n}, {beq pa'mey:n}, and {mebpa'mey:n}.
Triticale is a hybridization of wheat (genus Triticum) and rye (genus Secale). {pev:n:hyp,nolink} is not a known word, it is known only as an element in the word {loSpev:n}.
This is not a known word, and exists as an element in the word {cha'puj:n} and possibly also in the word {beqpuj:n}.

definition.en: a while back, a long time ago?

notes.en: Consider using {ben law'}.

qenHa':adv.hidden_notes: This word does not appear in canon. This entry is here for ease of reference only.

notes.en: A {yoqqoq:n@@yoq:n, -qoq:n} would, of course, be a "so-called humanoid".

qoqyoq:n.hidden_notes: This word does not appear in canon. This entry is here for ease of reference only.

notes.en: This is the name of a male in the Duolingo Klingon course.
This word doesn't appear in canon, but rather was invented for a blog post about science. It's here so that someone else doesn't invent a different word.

qulSo':n.hidden_notes: This word was coined by Felix Malmenbeck ({loghaD:n:nolink}), and roughly means "hidden fire".

notes.en: This word element appears to be synonymous with {DIvI':n}, but it is not known outside of a few compounds.
This refers to a small piece of text attached to something else, such as a post on a social network or a block of computer code.[1; 2]
According to the glossary of {Enemy Territory:src}, this animal prefers the shadow.

rISwI':n.hidden_notes: This was used in the Klingon-language subtitles for {DSC:src} on Netflix for the word "transponder" in spoken English dialogue.
rISwI':n.source: [1] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2017:src}, [2] {DSC - Battle at the Binary Stars:src}

rItHa':v.hidden_notes: This word does not appear in canon. This entry is here for ease of reference only.

notes.en: This element is not known to exist outside of {yInroH:n}.

definition.en: be agile, be nimble, be spry?

notes.en: This verb is not known to exist, but its existence is conjectured based on the idiom {pe'vIl roS:sen:idiom} and the verb {roSHa'moH:v}.
This is the {bI'rel tlharghDuj:n} commanded by {martaq:n:name}.
In the glossary to {Diplomatic Implausibility:src}, it is hypothesized that this is an animal from or with whose blood {ro'qegh'Iwchab:n} are made.
This word is not known to exist outside of the compound {SIS yoD:n}.

SIS:n.hidden_notes: MO said at the {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2011:src} that the apparent noun {SIS:n:hyp,nolink} is a fossilized remnant which is probably limited to the expression {SIS yoD:n}.[1]

notes.en: Known only from {De'wI' SoSbor'a':n}.
This word is not known to exist by itself, but appears to be one of the components of {Surchem:n}, with {chem:n:hyp}.

definition.en: earlier than expected, initially, at first?

tagha'Ha':adv.hidden_notes: This word does not appear in canon. This entry is here for ease of reference only.

notes.en: The gizzards of this animal, together with their contents, are sometimes served as food. The droppings of this animal are particularly foul-smelling.

taqnar:n.source: [1] {A Good Day to Die:src}, [2] {A Burning House:src}

notes.en:
In {Klingon Academy:src}, the symbol of the Klingon Empire (the imperial trefoil) is said to be called the "Heart of Virtue", or {tIq'ghob:n:nolink} "in the ancient tongue", by General Chang ({cheng:n:name}). In modern standard Klingon, "Heart of Virtue" would be {ghob tIq:n:nolink}. The two words are transposed in the manner of {paq'batlh:n}.

The three arms of the {tIq'ghob:n:nolink} are said to represent honor, loyalty, and duty.
According to the glossary to {A Burning House:src}, this is a large animal native to {rura' pente':n}.
This is the name of a male in the Duolingo Klingon course.

This element is known only from {tlharghDuj:n}. It seems to be a noun, but the existence of {HIvDuj:n:nolink} and {qughDuj:n:nolink} suggests that there may be an unknown verb {tlhargh:v:hyp,nolink} "to scout".

definition.en: You have entered the jurisdiction of the Klingon Empire.
definition.de: Ihr seid in die Zuständigkeit des klingonischen Imperium eingetreten.

tlhoSHa':adv.hidden_notes: This word does not appear in canon. This entry is here for ease of reference only.

tlhoyHa':adv.hidden_notes: This word does not appear in canon. This entry is here for ease of reference only.

notes.en: This refers to a concept in computer programming, namely, a segment of code which is repeatedly executed until some condition is met.

wejHa':adv.hidden_notes: This word does not appear in canon. This entry is here for ease of reference only.

notes.en: Since this is not a grammatical sentence, one can only assume that it is in some form of {no' Hol:n}. It is recommended to say {Qapla'!:sen} or {povjaj!:excl} instead.

yIghoSDo'!:excl.hidden_notes: This expression appears on the back cover of {How to Speak Klingon:src}, where it is translated as "Good luck".[1] Even though the sentences inside this book were provide by the Klingon Language Institute (see {tlhIngan Hol yejHaD:n}) and use proper grammar, it seems that whoever designed the cover just copied this erroneous expression from the Internet. The originator of this expression is unknown but it appeared on some fan websites in 2011, where it is claimed that it literally means "Go with fortune".

notes.en: This is used in the {ma'to'vor:n} ritual. It must be real and not replicated.[1]

'aDanjI':n.source: [1] {DS9 - Sons of Mogh:src}, [2] {A Good Day to Die:src}

definition.en: be landed? be in the air? (aircraft)

notes.en: This is an unknown element found in {'eDSeHcha:n}. Following the example of {lolSeHcha:n}, this should be a verb related to aircraft landing or take-off. This element or a homophone is also found in {'eDjen:n}.
This element is known only from {'ejDo':n} and {'ejyo':n}.
This is a Terran name used in the Duolingo Klingon course.
The word {'ISletlh:n:hyp,nolink} has never appeared by itself, but is found in {yan 'ISletlh:n}.
